title: F&I (Finance & Insurance) Manager
description:
At New Country, our people do whatever it takes to find solutions. We’re building a culture that’s genuinely engaged & dedicated to communities we serve. Our dealerships & employees pride themselves on being deeply involved in local communities, charities, nonprofit organization, and consider it a privilege to serve. With deep roots in the cities and towns where our car dealerships are located, we pride ourselves on a family atmosphere and strong customer bonds.

Benefits
* Medical and Dental
* 401K Plan
* Paid time off and vacation
* Growth opportunities
* Paid Training
* Family owned and operated
* Long term job security

Responsibilities
* The Junior Finance Manager is expected to sell vehicles as a Sales Lease Consultant and perform all normal duties for that position.
* Work directly with the Finance Manager to complete any needed Finance Delivery at the direction of dealership management.
* Review the figures that are presented by the salesperson and use them when closing the deal with the customer.
* Sell add-on products such as extended service plans and guaranteed auto protection (GAP) coverage, which protects the customer in the event the vehicle is totaled but she still owes more than it is worth.
* Benefit the customer by arranging for the financing of the vehicle purchase which can save the customer the time and hassle.
* If the customer's credit is less than stellar, the finance manager may be able to offer alternatives such as loans with higher interest rates or longer terms.
* Benefit the dealership by assisting in closing deals and bringing in additional revenue through add-on sales.

Qualifications
* Strong negotiation and communication skills are needed, since much of the job involves dealing with customers.
* Strong attention to detail to handle administrative tasks such as completing all the paperwork involved with purchasing a vehicle.
* Must have a thorough knowledge of the financial marketplace and keep abreast of changes in products and interest rates.
* A four-year college degree in a field such as finance or have relevant work experience, such as employment at a consumer finance company.
* Automotive Finance experience is required.
* ADP, Route One, DealerTrack, and High Volume experience a plus.

We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Night Auditor
description:
Overview:
**Opportunity: Night Auditor**  

Balance revenue and settle accounts nightly, maintain files, and reset the system for the next day of operations while performing Guest Service Agent tasks and duties. **Your Growth Path**  

Front Office Supervisor/Accounts Payable or Receivable Clerk – Front Office Manager **Your Focus*** Perform bookkeeping activities, such as balancing accounts and conducting nightly audits.
* Keep records of room availability and guests' accounts, manually or using computers.
* Prepare and distribute daily reports.
* Audit and reconcile cashiers.
* Audit, reconcile, consolidate, and transmit all credit cards on a timely basis.
* Input and update financial information into the BRAINS network.
* Check guests in/out and perform Guest Service Agents tasks.
* Respond to guest inquiries and resolve complaints.
* Be aware of guest satisfaction scores and work toward increasing departmental and overall guest satisfaction.
* Follow sustainability guidelines and practices related to HHM’s EarthView program.
* Practice safe work habits and wear protective safety equipment.
* Ensure overall guest satisfaction.
* Perform other duties as requested by management.

 **Your Background and Skills*** High School diploma or equivalent preferred.
* Previous night audit/accounting experience or equivalent training required.
* Computer knowledge/Excel and arithmetic skills required.
* FSD is a plus, required within 90 days of employment.

 **Work Environment and Context*** Work schedule varies and may include working on holidays, and weekends.
* Requires standing for extended periods, walking , lifting up to 25 pounds, bending and reaching.

 **What We Believe**  

People Are Our Capability – Hearts That Serve – Only Excellence – Stay Nimble - Own It
About Us :

HHM Hotels is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, age, religion, disability, veteran status, genetic information, citizenship status, or any other group protected by law.

title: Warehouse Crew Member
description:
**Division:** All Access Staging New Jersey


**Department:** Rentals


**FLSA Status:** Non-Exempt


**Employee Type:** Full-Time , Temporary


**Pay Type:** Hourly / bi-weekly


**Pay Range:** $18-19 / hourly

  


**Summary:**


The Rental Crew member repairs and maintains proprietary rental equipment, performs general warehouse duties, and assists with final assembly and shipping/receiving. This is a non-exempt, entry-level, hourly position that includes eligibility for PTO, health insurance, and 401k program after probationary period.

  


**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**


* Operate within standard operating and safety procedures
* Liaise and communicate well with other departments in finishing projects in a timely manner and quality fashion
* Achieve the creation of high-quality Versa gear that represents the company well in the global staging market
* Utilize Technical Design documents in the construction of staging and equipment
* Complete all assigned crew training modules
* Maintain and repair rental equipment
* Restock rental equipment
* Load and unload trucks
* Operate forklift, trucks, scissor lifts (reporting any maintenance needs)
* Clean and maintain work area, including yard and storage trailers
* May be asked to assist in the set-up and disassembly of rental and custom equipment

  




**Qualification Requirements:**


* High School diploma or equivalent preferred
* Reliable transportation
* Clean and neat appearance
* Ability to work weekends and overtime
* Familiarity with requirements of touring equipment and terminology a plus
* English speaking preferred, bilingual a plus

  




**Physical Demands and Abilities:**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions.


* Regularly required to talk and hear
* Visual abilities include close vision and the ability to focus
* Ability to regularly lift 50 – 75 lbs. and occasionally up to 100 lbs.
* Ability to work with small hand and power tools
* Must be able to follow direction
* A positive attitude and punctuality are a must

  




This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee(s) incumbent in this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments. All duties and responsibilities are essential functions and requirements and are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. To perform this job successfully, the incumbents will possess the skills, aptitudes, and abilities to perform each duty proficiently. Some requirements may exclude individuals who pose a direct threat or significant risk to the health or safety of themselves or others. The requirements listed in this document are the minimum levels of knowledge, skills, or abilities. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an “at will” relationship.

title: Part-Time Warehouse Operations Associate
description:
**WHY YOU WILL WANT TO WORK HERE:** Wizard Studios is a national company whose unique and award-winning special event visioning, design, and implementation abilities are sought after by Fortune 500 companies, major Non-Profit Agencies, Cultural Institutions, and Tourist Destinations.



Wizard Studios takes simple but elegant ideas and complex concepts and manifests them into highly crafted yet scalable public and private events. Our firm maintains a lifelong belief in the power of special events as the most effective means to engage, inspire and inform people who come together and experience our productions. It is through opportunities to share common activities, whether cultural, recreational, or educational, that connect the participants to each other, exposing them to new concepts, experiences, and venues.

  


**WAREHOUSE OPERATIONS COORDINATOR: JOB RESPONSIBILITIES**



To coordinate the Company’s warehouse operations in a manner that will improve the Company’s efficiency and profitability; help achieve the Company’s mission and goals and deliver results in outstanding performance standards that exceed our customers’ expectations. This is an entry-level position and ideal for someone looking to gain experience in a warehouse and production environment.


**Reports to:** Director of Operations.


**Reporting Responsibility:** Operations & Production.

  


**General Responsibilities:**


**The Operations Coordinator’s responsibilities involve:**


* Fulfilling orders from Production for goods from our warehouse packed efficiently onto trucks for delivery
* Receiving deliveries and entering them into inventory through the company’s inventory management system
* Maintaining a clean, efficient warehouse
* Repairing & maintaining the equipment that comes in and out of the warehouse.
* Maintain a positive attitude that promotes teamwork within the Company and a favorable image of the Company.
* Working a rotating schedule that will include time in the warehouse and on job sites for load-ins and load-outs.

  




**Loading and unloading trucks:**


**The Operations Coordinator will ensure:**


* The goods needed from the warehouse are scanned and packed securely onto trucks.
* Ensure the goods returning to the warehouse are scanned, checked for completeness, and working order before being returned to their place in the warehouse.

  




**Warehouse Maintenance:**


**On a daily basis, the Operations Coordinator will ensure the:**


* The floors, truck bay, and aisleways of the warehouse are clean, dry, painted, and clear of equipment or debris.
* The aisles and truck bays are appropriately lit.
* The shelves of the warehouse are clean, dry, and secure.
* The trash and recyclables are neatly stowed until removed by trash haulers.

  




**Equipment Maintenance:**


**On a daily basis, the Operations Coordinator will ensure that:**


* All Company-owned equipment is kept in good working condition.
* The Receiving Desk is manned for all incoming deliveries, including Company-owned equipment returning from a job.
* The received deliveries are checked for completeness and are in proper working condition.
* The equipment in the warehouse is clean and free of dust or debris.

**Facilities Maintenance:**  

**On a daily basis, the Operations Coordinator will ensure that:**

  

* Perform routine walkthroughs of the facility to assess general conditions.
* Use and maintain vacuums, brooms, mops, and squeegees for the cleaning and general maintenance of floors, walls, carpets, furniture, etc.
* Move furniture, equipment, supplies, and tools on an incidental basis
* Provide services including proactive maintenance, moves/changes, and reporting of any issues with HVAC, plumbing, electrical, and reactive maintenance to the appropriate repair teams.
* Perform routine walkthroughs of the facility to assess general conditions.
* Responds to emergency cleanups during the day, such as clogged drains and spills.
* Escalate any problems or issues that cannot be addressed to the Director of Operations.
* Support health and safety initiatives.
* Performs other work-related duties as assigned.

  


**Follow regulations:**


* Observe OSHA, state, and federal safety regulations
* Follow all company and regulatory agency safety policies

  




**Reporting:**


**The Operations Coordinator will:**


* Alert Management of any broken or damaged equipment.
* Alert Management of any need for expendable supplies (like tape, zip ties, duvetyn, etc.)

  




**Other Duties:**


* Additional tasks as assigned by management.
* Provide suggestions to improve efficiency.

  

**JOB QUALIFICATIONS:**


* Excellent listener and communicator
* Able to lift up to 75 pounds
* The hours of these positions vary, based primarily on the scheduling of each event. Candidates with open availability are highly preferred (days, nights, or weekends, and occasional overtime available.)
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Must possess professional interpersonal skills to interact with clients
* Solid working knowledge of computers and mobile devices
* Strong organizational skills with attention to detail.
* Must be accurate, detail orientated – with the ability to operate well under pressure
* Proficiency with the use of all equipment and tools
* Ability to multi-task and stay focused on critical objectives
* Ability to travel out of town for several days/weeks consecutively when required

  


**ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS:**  

Will be working in varying weather and temperature conditions, including but not limited to snow/cold temperatures during the winter and hot temperatures during the summer.

  



We have designed and built our culture around a set of core values. We look for candidates who embody those values and will help bring them to life through their work. As part of the interview process, we share those values with candidates and actively search for people who will thrive in our environment.


**OUR PURPOSE**: Wizard Studios exists to produce events and create experiences that leave an enduring impression on you and your audience.  

**OUR MISSION:** Consistently delivering services and experiences that turn our customers into evangelists for our brand.  

**OUR BRAND PROMISE**: Since 2002, exceeding expectations to ensure you hire us again.  

  

**OUR CORE VALUES:**


**WORKING TOGETHER** – Teamwork across all departments maximizes our collective impact to inspire, challenge, and support each other to be our best and sustain our efforts.


**INNOVATION** – Solve unique problems with unique solutions.


**ZEAL** – Anticipate people’s expectations and strive to consistently over-deliver on our promises.


**AMBITION** – Passion for what you do makes us a great place to work.


**RESPECT** – Open communication kindly delivered, and openly received


**DEPENDABLE** – Don’t just solve problems, work to actively prevent them!

  


* Wizard Studios is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all


aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will  

receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sex,  

sexual orientation, transgender status, gender dysphoria, national origin, age, religion, disability,  

military and veteran status, marital or parental status, citizenship status, genetic information or  

any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision. We require  

applications to be completed online. Please visit  

https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm for more information.

title: Fulfillment Specialist (Part-Time)
description:
JOB SUMMARY

  

As an Order Fulfillment Specialist at Premo Cannabis Company, you will primarily work in the shipping and receiving area of our warehouse. Your responsibilities will include preparing and staging items for delivery, handling incoming shipments, recording and verifying shipping information, and ensuring correct labeling and packaging of finished products.

  

Part-Time Fullfillment Specialist work between 15-29 hours per week.

  

Applicants must be over the age of 21 and consent to a State and Federal Background check.

  

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  

* Picking/Fulfilling Orders
* Maintain the organization of finished goods inventory storage to ensure accurate order picking and packing
* Manifest sales orders for finished goods delivery
* Retrieve finished goods from vault storage for individual dispensaries
* Verify packaging and marketing labels for finished goods
* Ensure products' unit counts and compliance labels match dispensary manifests to prevent customer rejections or complaints
* Make adjustments to invoices based on inventory or sales discrepancies

  

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  

* High school diploma or general education degree (GED)
* 2+ years of customer service, distribution, or warehouse experience
* Strong organizational skills and ability to meet deadlines
* Collaborative mindset and ability to work well with peers
* Effective time management and multitasking abilities
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced, changing, and challenging environment
* Basic knowledge of Excel, Word, and general computer skills
* Fast, efficient, and adaptable
* Experience in an environment with constructive feedback and input
* Must be 21 years or older
* Full knowledge of all applicable laws, regulations, and requirements to maintain 100% compliance at all times, including staying updated on any changes
* Compliance with all regulatory requirements for working in the cannabis industry
* Ability to obtain and retain a Registered Agent Card issued by the state of New Jersey
* Excellent organization and time management skills
* Detail-oriented and focused
* Ability to absorb training and follow instructions
* Clear and effective communication skills
* Other duties and responsibilities as assigned

  

COMPANY OVERVIEW

  

Premo Cannabis Company, LLC is a retail dispensary based in Keyport, New Jersey. We aim to provide a premium, unmatched customer-focused retail experience and contribute to the growth of the cannabis industry. Our mission is to improve the quality of our customers' lives by offering high-quality, consistent, and carefully curated cannabis products tailored to their unique needs. We prioritize health and wellness through a knowledgeable and dedicated team. We value our employees, our communities, and our vision of shaping the future of cannabis.

  

EEO STATEMENT

  

Premo Cannabis Company, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity. We do not discriminate in our hiring practices based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

company_description: We are the cannabis connoisseurs that will elevate you higher

title: Editorial Assistant - Riverhead Books - (Onsite)
description:
Riverhead Books, an imprint at Penguin Random House, seeks an Editorial Assistant to provide administrative and editorial support to two editors – one Editor in Chief and one Executive Editor - working on both narrative non-fiction and literary fiction. We’re looking for an organized, detail-oriented, meticulous self-starter with very strong writing and communication skills to provide all-around project support for all stages of the publishing process.

 **This is a fully in-office position based in midtown NYC.**

 **Essential Functions and Responsibilities:**

* Helps shepherd projects and authors through the publication process, from acquisition (including CIS, P&L, pass to press, routing copyedits and first pass, gathering author questionnaires and author photos, etc) to finished book, ensuring that authors and others have needed materials in timely fashion.
* Anticipates deadlines for and assists in drafting, with editor, the supporting materials for titles (TI sheets, galley copy, flap copy, reading group guides, audio scripts, etc) as needed for a variety of in-house and consumer-facing uses.
* Assists with mailings, expense reports, and other administrative tasks.
* Works closely with other departments (marketing, publicity, rights, sales) to provide needed materials and other assistance.
* Regularly monitors and updates key information and metadata, thinking critically about metadata changes needed through the life of the book.
* Helps editors track and evaluate submissions; writes reader’s reports and rejection letters; researches competitive titles and creates basic P&Ls on prospective titles.
* Reads projects under contract and provides editorial feedback to editors upon request.

 **Essential Qualifications/Requirements:**

  



+ Prior office experience or related internship preferred
+ Excellent organizational skills
+ Strong communication and follow-up skills
+ Strong writing skills
+ Strong reading and analytical skills
+ Strong multitasking and problem-solving skills
+ Attentive to detail
+ Interest in and enthusiasm for book publishing
+ Strong PC skills (Microsoft Word and Excel)
+ Some knowledge of contemporary fiction or nonfiction a plus
+ Knowledge of social media a plus

 **The salary for this position is $48,000. All positions are currently eligible for annual profit award or bonus, subject to Company results.**

  

Penguin Random House job postings include a good faith compensation range for each open position. The salary range listed is specific to each particular open position and takes into account various factors including the specifics of the individual role, and candidate's relevant experience and qualifications.

  

Full-time employees are eligible for our comprehensive benefits program. Our range of benefits include, but are not limited to, Medical/Prescription drug insurance, Dental, Vision, Health Care/Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings Account, Pre-Tax and Roth 401(k), Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance, Life/AD&D Insurance, Commuter Benefits, Student Loan Repayment Program, Educational Assistance & generous paid time off.

  

Penguin Random House is the leading adult and children's publishing house in North America, the United Kingdom and many other regions around the world. In publishing the best books in every genre and subject for all ages, we are committed to quality, excellence in execution, and innovation throughout the entire publishing process: editorial, design, marketing, publicity, sales, production, and distribution. Our vibrant and diverse international community of nearly 300 publishing brands and imprints include Ballantine Bantam Dell, Berkley, Clarkson Potter, Crown, DK, Doubleday, Dutton, Grosset & Dunlap, Little Golden Books, Knopf, Modern Library, Pantheon, Penguin Books, Penguin Press, Penguin Random House Audio, Penguin Young Readers, Portfolio, Puffin, Putnam, Random House, Random House Children's Books, Riverhead, Ten Speed Press, Viking, and Vintage, among others. More information can be found at http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/.<http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/>  

  

Penguin Random House values the array of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

 **Company:** Penguin Random House LLC

**Country:** United States of America

**State/Region:** New York

**City:** New York

**Postal Code:** 10019

**Job ID:** 273254

title: Scheduling Coordinator
description:
Join Our Team as a Scheduling Coordinator!

  

Are you an experienced scheduling coordinator looking for a rewarding career opportunity? Look no further! Affirmed Home Care, New York’s premier private pay home care company, is seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Scheduling Coordinator. **Any application without at least one year of scheduling or coordination experience will not be considered.**

  

Our ideal candidate will possess:


* A minimum of one year of scheduling or coordination experience
* The ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
* The willingness to participate in a PAID on-call rotation
* Excellent organizational and communication skills
* Proficiency in using scheduling software and tools, as well as Microsoft Office

  

As a Scheduling Coordinator at Affirmed Home Care, you will be responsible for:

* Efficiently coordinating and scheduling caregivers for client visits
* Ensuring timely and accurate communication with clients, caregivers, and other team members
* Managing and updating schedules to accommodate changes and requests
* Collaborating with the care management team to ensure optimal client care
* Maintaining accurate records and documentation

  

We value our employees and offer a comprehensive benefits package, including:

* Medical, dental, and vision insurance to keep you healthy
* Generous paid time off to maintain a healthy work-life balance
* Weekly direct deposit for convenient and timely payment

  

Don't miss this opportunity to join a dynamic team and make a difference in the lives of our clients. Apply TODAY, or call us at 212-423-5611 to learn more! Affirmed Home Care is an equal opportunity employer.
company_description: At Affirmed Home Care we believe in the philosophy of “compromise nothing”.
